definition: to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon

sentences.english: Dickens was contemporary with Gong Zizheng.
sentences.chinese: 狄更斯和龚自珍同时代。

sentences.english: The piano soon developed into the contemporary nine- to ten-foot concert grand.
sentences.chinese: 不久钢琴就发展到同时代的九到十英尺的平台大钢琴。

sentences.english: Jiao Yanshou and Wang Zhaojun lived in the same time. Jiao Yanshou wrote two poems of Zhaojun.
sentences.chinese: 焦延寿和昭君是同时代的人，他写过两首咏昭君的诗。

sentences.english: Your own contemporaries tend to self-centeredness.
sentences.chinese: 你自己的同时代人都趋向于自我为中心。

sentences.english: Each of these people was doubtless called lucky by some contemporaries.
sentences.chinese: 毫无疑问，这些人个个都可被同时代的人称为幸运者。
济慈和雪莱是同时代人。

sentences.english: Mr Kemp was one of the most prominent Republicans of his generation.
sentences.chinese: 康普先生是他同时代最杰出的共和党人之一。
雪莱和济慈是同时代的人。

sentences.english: Tang Xianzu, a playwright of Ming Dynasty in 16th Century, was the coeval of Shakespeare of Britain.
sentences.chinese: 16世纪明代的汤显祖与英国的莎士比亚是同时代人。

sentences.english: He distanced the most skillful of his con temporaries.
sentences.chinese: 他远远胜过他同时代技术最熟练者。
拜伦和渥兹华斯是同时代的人。

sentences.english: Her paintings are second-rate productions, alongside those of some of her contemporaries.
sentences.chinese: 她的画作跟她同时代一些人比起来，只算得二流作品。

sentences.english: There was a lot of validity to that contemporary cultural fear.
sentences.chinese: 这种同时代的人在文化上对他的恐惧心理确实存在。

sentences.english: She excelled all other authors of her day.
sentences.chinese: 她超过同时代的所有其他作家。

sentences.english: Contemporary accounts describe him as composed and cooperative.
sentences.chinese: 同时代的报道把他描述为沉着镇静而且合作。

sentences.english: What did Homer or any of Homer's contemporaries know about Mulciber?
sentences.chinese: 荷马和荷马同时代的人对于莫西伯又知道什么呢？

definition: representative individual (of a school of thought)
to discuss two disparate things together (idiom); to mention on equal terms/to place on a par with/(often with negatives: impossible to mention X in the same breath as Y)

the not-very-distant past/modern times, excluding recent decades/(in the context of Chinese history) the period from the Opium Wars until the May 4th Movement (mid-19th century to 1919)/capitalist times (pre-1949)
to be shoulder to shoulder/to be on an equal level with/Taiwan pr. [bi4 jian1]
the present age/in office/the current office holder
